descriptionHtml:
People ask me very often about the mods that I\'m using. So here\'s a google docs spreadsheet whit all my mods, that I\'m updating daily and everytime I\'m changing something on my own game.

[url=https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0Ai4hatSUGsXWdDQtc2JPcmxiM09Ed2dtSGZTTFpSelE#gid=0]Google Docs Spreadsheet[/url]

[b][size=3]What do I get if I check this out?[/size][/b]
A wonderful looking Skyrim game, with a setup that improves over time. You can use the mods that you want and if I see a better mod or something new you will be the first who sees it.

[b][size=3]What computer are you using? Can I run it?[/size][/b]
CPU: Intel Core i7-3770k @3,5GHz (overclocked @ ~ 4,5GHz)
GPU: GeForce GTX 680 Jetstream 4GB
RAM: 16 GB DDR3

If you can run the stuff or not will depend on the mods you\'re picking. For example it\'s maybe not necessary to pick just the best textures for all packages of the Texture Pack Combiner. Somewhen Skyrim isn\'t supporting the VRAM anymore.

- Screenshots show how my game looks like
- The mods are categorized and linked, with a short note if necessary.
- Anytime I change a mod I mark it:
[color=green]Green[/color] - The mod just got added, after some days it will become \"standard\", so the color will become white.
[color=red]Red[/color] - The mod will get deleted, the reason is written in the \"Note\" column, after some days I\'ll remove it from the list.
[color=grey]Grey[/color] - Temporarily deactivated because it caused conflicts with another mod or I want to try a different, similar mod.

I will save copies of the modlist daily and upload them, so that the changes are documented.
Dunno what else to say, hf with it.

[center]
[img]http://www.skyrimmodsreviews.com/skyrimnexus/live_modlist/site_01.jpg[/img]
[/center]
author: SaioTV
